I'm confused by a CI run on nightly, which Github shows as successful even if it fails in the same way as other runs in the PR which are correctly shown as failures... any idea?
(see <https://github.com/JuliaTesting/ReTest.jl/pull/7/checks?check_run_id=1972811547> and <https://github.com/JuliaTesting/ReTest.jl/pull/7/checks?check_run_id=1972688805>)

text:
It's this:
<https://github.com/JuliaTesting/ReTest.jl/blob/cfadf30968a7855cd1e53234649a6536f463f9ce/.github/workflows/CI.yml#L53>
GitHub Actions doesn't really have an "allowed failure" feature. You can either have nightly always be green even if it fails, or have it mark your entire CI suite as failing.

text: Oh right, thank you! I'm embarassed, as I specifically looked for something like this in the CI file, but was searching for a string like "allow failure" and missed "continue-on-error" :picard_facepalm:
